alert.note: Alert for Eastern Sierra Slopes of Inyo County (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LasVegas (Southern Nevada, Southeastern California, Northwestern Arizona)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued March 19 at 1:54AM PDT until March 22 at 5:00PM PDT by NWS LasVegas
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH 11 AM PDT MONDAY... ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM EARLY TUESDAY MORNING THROUGH WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, total snow accumulations of 4 to 8 inches 7000 and 9500 feet and up to 12 inches above 9500 feet. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph. For the Winter Storm Watch, heavy snow possible with total snow accumulations of 8 to 18 inches between 6000 and 9500 feet and up to 2 feet above 9500 feet. Winds could gust as high as 50 mph. * WHERE...Eastern Sierra Slopes. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, through 11 AM PDT Monday. For the Winter Storm Watch, from early Tuesday morning through Wednesday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Heavy snow accumulations could cause tree or power pole damage, resulting in power outages. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow levels will start out 5000 to 6000 feet on Sunday and Monday, dropping to 4000 to 5000 feet on Tuesday and dropping to 3000 to 4000 feet on Wednesday. Highest precipitation rates will occur on Tuesday.
info.instruction: A Winter Weather Advisory for snow means periods of snow will cause primarily travel difficulties. Expect snow covered roads and limited visibilities, and use caution while driving. A Winter Storm Watch means there is potential for significant snow accumulations that may impact travel. Continue to monitor the latest forecasts. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Sierra Slopes of Inyo County
